Name: Situla
Description: Situla for libations, with a ring for suspension. The decoration, arranged in yuxtaposed scenes, is now to a large extent lost. At the top it shows two boats alluding to the diurnal and nocturnal sun. In the middle register we see an officiant offering to a series of divinities, arranged in a row with an ityphallic Min-Amun at the head. The bottom register is lost. The receptacle's pointed bottom is decorated with a lotus flower.
